article_title: Worry Over Inequality Occupies Wall Street
article_text:
Even if they have found the widening gulf between America's haves and have-nots troubling, inequality isn't something fund managers have worried about professionally. That may be changing.

Over the years, the only way inequality has really mattered to investors has been as a factor when considering stocks. If the rich are getting richer, companies that cater to them have better prospects. Goldman Sachs Group, for example, recently conducted a survey that showed optimism among high-income consumers relative to low-income...

twitter.description: Income and wealth inequality may have stretched to the point that it could hurt the economy and markets. But a reversal of the trend wouldn't treat investors kindly, either.
twitter.creator: @jdlahart
